item.title: Trying to remove an Object
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

				HOW TO DELETE AN EXISTING OBJECT OR WALL

SERVER BASE: ANY

DIFFICULTY: 1/10

FILES MODIFIED: client.java

KNOWLEDGE: HOW TO COPY, PASTE, SAVE AND COMPILE

CREDITS: 90% -fedexer - 10% me for re-wording it

					HOW TO ADD VOIDS

HOW TO ADD A VOID: ADDING VOIDS ARE QUITE SIMPLE… ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS SEARCH FOR EXISTING VOID AND THEN CREATE YOUR NEW VOID AT THE END OR START OF THE LIST.

						STEP 1

OK FIRST ADD THIS VOID FOR OBJECTS/BUILDINGS

public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10); }

AND THIS 1 FOR WALLS

public void deletethatwall(int objectX, int objectY) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0); }

						STEP 2

NEXT, ADD THIS VOID FOR OBJECTS/ BUILDINGS (CAN BE MODIFIED FOR PERSONAL PREFERENCE)

public void Deleteobjects() { deletethatobject(X CO-ORDS, Y CO-ORDS); //WHAT IT DOES HERE }

THEN ADD THIS VOID FOR WALLS (CAN ALSO BE MODIFIED FOR PERSONAL PREFERENCE)

public void Deletewalls() { deletethatwall(X CO-ORDS, Y CO-ORDS); //WHAT IT DOES HERE }

						STEP 3

NOW SEARCH FOR “case 121” AND DIRECTLY BELLOW IT, ADD THIS FOR OBJECTS

Deleteobjects(); <-- IT DELETES THE OBJECT/BUILDING YOU PLACED IN THE CO-ORDS.

AND DIRECTLY BELLOW IT, ADD THIS 1 FOR WALLS

Deletewalls(); <-- IT DELETES THE WALL YOU PLACED IN THE CO-ORDS.

					SAVE, COMPILE, ENJOY!

WELL I HOPE I HELPED
ALSO, REMEMBER THAT -FEDEXER- MADE THIS. I JUST REWORDED IT.
IF YOU HAVE ANY TROUBLE, ADD ME ON MSN AND I’LL HELP YOU.

Read full topic
